alert.note: Alert for Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 11:05AM EDT until April 02 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Kentucky...Indiana... Ohio River at Shawneetown affecting Hardin, Crittenden, Union and Gallatin Counties. Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Spencer, Henderson, Daviess, Vanderburgh and Warrick Counties. Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam affecting Union and Posey Counties. Ohio River at Mount Vernon affecting Henderson, Vanderburgh, Union and Posey Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall is resulting in rises on the Ohio River. The river is forecast to rise above flood stage at several locations during the first half of the week. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 34.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 40.2 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
